result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon T. VICE

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in custody.
The State moves to dismiss and read in all counts.  The defendant plead to charges in 15 CF 254, 15 CF 375, 15 CF 269, 15 CM 244 and 15 CM 105.  Motion granted.
$200.00 cash bail transferred to 15 CF 375 and applied towards restitution.
Minutes.

Plea date is set for 09-16-15 at 10:00 a.m.
E-mail containing the plea agreement.

ADDRESS INFO for Brandon T. VICE
Current: 2336 Roosevelt Ave., Two Rivers, WI 54241 United States  (Effective: 08-05-2015)
Prior: 2604 16th Street, Two Rivers, WI 54241 United States

This case is riding along with 15 CF 254 which is set for a settlement conference on 07-16-15 at 10:40 a.m. and a plea date on 10-09-15 at 3:00 p.m.
Minutes.

Defendant in custody on bench warrant.  The matter is continued for a status conference on 06-25-15 at 1:30 p.m., riding along with 15 CF 254 which is set for a preliminary hearing on that day.  The $200.00 cash bail previously furnished is continued by the court and the defendant is released from custody.
Bench warrant with service of officer thereon.
Minutes.

Defendant failed to appear for a hearing.
State requests warrant and moves for forfeiture of bail.
Court authorizes warrant and grants the motion to forfeit bail.
Minutes.
Defendant's Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 04-14-15 at 9:00 a.m.   Plea date is set for 06-03-15 at 10:30 a.m.   
Minutes.

Phone message from defendant requesting adjournment.
Initial appearance is adjourned to 03-09-15 at 1:30 p.m.

At 3:15 p.m., $200.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of felony theft and 3 counts bail jumping.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 03-02-15 at 2:30 p.m. Bail is set at $200.00 cash with teh conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release and have no contact with Manitowoc Maritime Museum or Quentin Kettenbeil.  Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody. Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
